intro: Anthocleista gossweileri, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, often hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated seed pods. It is typically found in moist, forested areas and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine. Anthocleista gossweileri is also noted for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique fruiting structures.
